# PyMdown Extensions - Tabbed Module

## Overview

The `pymdownx.tabbed` module is a Markdown extension that enables the creation of tabbed content blocks in Markdown documents. It processes special syntax to generate HTML structures with radio button-based tabs that can be styled with CSS to create interactive tabbed interfaces.

## Purpose

This extension allows users to organize content into tabs using a simple Markdown syntax, making it easier to present multiple related pieces of information in a compact, organized manner.

## Basic Syntax

The extension recognizes tab blocks using the following syntax:

```markdown
=== "Tab Title"
    Tab content goes here

=== "Another Tab"
    More content here
```

### Special Modifiers

- `===+ "Title"` - Makes the tab active/selected by default
- `===! "Title"` - Creates a new tab group (breaks from previous group)
- `===+! "Title"` or `===!+ "Title"` - Combines both behaviors

## Key Classes

### TabbedProcessor

The main block processor that handles the parsing of tabbed content.

**Key Features:**
- Processes tab syntax and creates appropriate HTML structure
- Handles nested content and indentation
- Manages tab grouping and numbering
- Supports both standard and alternate styling

**Important Methods:**
- `test(parent, block)` - Determines if a block contains tab syntax
- `run(parent, blocks)` - Converts tab syntax to HTML elements
- `parse_content(parent, block)` - Handles content parsing and sibling detection

### TabbedTreeprocessor

Post-processes the generated HTML to add slugified IDs to tabs when configured.

**Key Features:**
- Generates unique IDs for tabs based on their titles
- Handles ID collision prevention
- Supports combining with parent header slugs
- Uses configurable slug separators

### TabbedExtension

The main extension class that integrates with Markdown.

**Configuration Options:**
- `alternate_style` (bool) - Use alternate HTML structure
- `slugify` (callable) - Function to generate tab IDs
- `combine_header_slug` (bool) - Combine tab slug with parent header
- `separator` (str) - Character used in slug generation

## Generated HTML Structure

### Standard Style
```html
<div class="tabbed-set" data-tabs="1:2">
    <input type="radio" name="__tabbed_1" id="__tabbed_1_1" checked="checked">
    <label for="__tabbed_1_1">Tab 1</label>
    <div class="tabbed-content">
        <!-- Tab 1 content -->
    </div>
    <input type="radio" name="__tabbed_1" id="__tabbed_1_2">
    <label for="__tabbed_1_2">Tab 2</label>
    <div class="tabbed-content">
        <!-- Tab 2 content -->
    </div>
</div>
```

### Alternate Style
```html
<div class="tabbed-set tabbed-alternate" data-tabs="1:2">
    <input type="radio" name="__tabbed_1" id="__tabbed_1_1" checked="checked">
    <input type="radio" name="__tabbed_1" id="__tabbed_1_2">
    <div class="tabbed-labels">
        <label for="__tabbed_1_1">Tab 1</label>
        <label for="__tabbed_1_2">Tab 2</label>
    </div>
    <div class="tabbed-content">
        <div class="tabbed-block">
            <!-- Tab 1 content -->
        </div>
        <div class="tabbed-block">
            <!-- Tab 2 content -->
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
```

## Usage Example

```python
import markdown
from pymdownx import tabbed

# Basic usage
md = markdown.Markdown(extensions=['pymdownx.tabbed'])

# With configuration
md = markdown.Markdown(
    extensions=['pymdownx.tabbed'],
    extension_configs={
        'pymdownx.tabbed': {
            'alternate_style': True,
            'slugify': lambda x, sep: x.lower().replace(' ', sep),
            'separator': '-'
        }
    }
)
```

## Notes and Considerations

### CSS Requirements
- The extension generates HTML structure only
- CSS is required to create the actual tabbed interface appearance
- Radio buttons and labels work together to create tab switching behavior

### Content Handling
- Supports nested lists and complex content within tabs
- Handles proper indentation detection
- Maintains Markdown processing for tab content

### Performance
- Uses regex for syntax detection
- Efficient tree processing for ID generation
- Maintains state for tab group counting

### Limitations
- Requires specific indentation for nested content
- Tab titles must be quoted strings
- Limited to radio button-based implementation (single selection per group)

## Integration Notes

- Registers at priority 105 in block processors
- Tree processor runs at priority 4 when slugification is enabled
- Properly integrates with other Markdown extensions
- Maintains extension state across multiple document processing
